actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress regarding the Kurds in northern Iraq.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the United States should seek Turkish permission to extend beyond June 1992 the agreement that permits the stationing of U.S. military forces in southern Turkey for purposes of Operation Provide Comfort (the relief effort for the Kurds); (2) the Government of Turkey should respond positively to such a request; (3) the United Nations' presence in northern Iraq should be extended; and (4) the United States and the international community should attach high priority to persuading the Government of Iraq to lift the economic boycott of northern Iraq.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress regarding the Kurds in northern Iraq.
